issue.title: Cloudsim performance insufficient to run stable control loops

content.raw:
![](data/bitbucket.org/repo/8ze6Mjd/images/3031425478-image.png)
‌

How many of these instances are involved in one simulated run? Do I understand correctly [#!/osrf/subt/wiki/cloudsim\_architecture](#!/osrf/subt/wiki/cloudsim_architecture) that each robot controller gets its own instance of g3s.xlarge and there only the solution container and the bridge container are run? Is the performance impact of the bridge significant or is more or less the whole instance available for the controller? Do you know what vCPU is? They only say it is “based on Intel Xeon 2.7GHz”. Is the GPU shared in any way with any other code/customer or is it dedicated full time to the controller?
content.html:

Is the performance impact of the bridge significant or is more or less the whole instance available for the controller? Do you know what vCPU is? They only say it is “based on Intel Xeon 2.7GHz”. Is the GPU shared in any way with any other code/customer or is it dedicated full time to the controller?
